description.narrative: The programme aims to improve the quality of life of communities, especially vulnerable children, in Kirewa, East Uganda. 94% of the population are farmers, but food security is not stable. Erosion and unexpected changes in climate affect crops. The progra mme has supported for the foundation of a farmers? union for the promotion of farmers? livelihoods. The foundation has expanded to cover thousands of people already and they have hired a technical expert to support the farmers. A village bank has been esta blished in order to enable affordable loans. Community mobilization and action is central in order to ensure better quality public services in the field of education and health. Through community action, lunch meals are now provided for school students. HI V and AIDS awareness is promoted by volunteers and committed religious leaders in the area. As a results, the number of people tested on their HIV status has increased markedly. The programme benefits 21.000 people in 39 villages. The main partner is World Vision Uganda that runs the implementation and accounts for the use of funding.
